abstract: Women in a remote Amazon village weave baskets for export to the U.S., aiming for “productive conservation” that protects the environment and offers better lives for the weavers and their communities.
snippet: Women in a remote Amazon village weave baskets for export to the U.S., aiming for “productive conservation” that protects the environment and offers better lives for the weavers and their communities.
lead_paragraph: SAN ANTONIO DE PINTUYACU, Peru  Women in this remote Amazon village can weave fibers from the branch of the chambira palm tree into practically anything they need  fishing nets, hammocks, purses, skirts and dental floss.

headline.main: For Peruvians, Baskets for the U.S. Market Bring a New Way of Life
headline.print_headline: For Peruvians, Baskets for the U.S. Market Bring a New Way of Life
